intro: Erucaria reboudii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often with a rosette-like arrangement of foliage. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
